column4: i have a cd but it's corrupted i think... i checked and my edubuntu burn has an md5 log file, the kubuntu one doesn't and messes up on booting
i don't know if the guy who downloaded the images for me still has them on his computer
but i burned the cd's from ubuntu (k3b?) and i don't know why one had md5 checking and the other not
how about AV for scanning my windows backup files?
and if i have one ubuntu cd can't i just copy the thing from nero? the guy who let me burn from his pc said you can't just copy images
i see, omnid... but i read linux can be affected by worms
i was reading a little on emulators today
didn't the first worm ever affect unix?
lol evan
i have a 2 year degree in windows programming.... all for what now that i will change to linux
programming what language?
commands are fun, actually ... if i know them, it's always fun to just let my finger rattle off a command
vb6.... also took a little c and sql
well the C and sql are still applicable
so i guess i can go further with c and sql or learn c++ and do alright
*nods*
and vb is evil so it's good to be rid of it
heh
there's C# for linux, and there's also python (my fav)
i remember how good it felt learning c
plenty of good languages to use for development
